issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Reuse closeResponder to reset the response variable in DataStreamer#run

comments.body: Attach a simple patch for fixing this. According to the comment from [~xiaochen] , I reuse the method {{closeResponder}} here.

This message was automatically generated.

This is a trivial refactor, so no test needed. Error from checkstyle already exists, and is only improved by this.

Only a super trivial comment, since we're checking nullity in {{closeResponder}}, we could remove that from the if clause {{errorState.hasError() && response != null}}. +1 pending this.

Thanks for working on this, [~linyiqun].
Good catch, thanks [~xiaochen] for the quick review! Attach a new patch for addressing your comment.

+1, will commit after 24 hours. (I edited the title to be more specific, feel free to let me know if you want it otherwise)
I have committed this to trunk. Thanks [~linyiqun]] for the contribution.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10388 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10388/])
HDFS-10820. Reuse closeResponder to reset the response variable in (xiao: rev 0690f0969efef201b074a8b26400b2e5ba9b97ad)
